question: Which among the following is not one of the realms of “being” as stated by Buddhism?
explanation: The 10 realms of being as stated in Buddhism are Buddha, Bodhisattva, Pratyeka Buddha, Sravaka, Heavenly beings, Human beings, Asura, Beasts, Preta, Depraved men. These ten realms occur at the same time which means that each one realm has the remaining nine realms inclusive.
